javadoc: Represents a section and section_64 structure. @see mach-o/loader.h

methods.javadoc: DO NOT USE THIS CONSTRUCTOR, USE create*(GenericFactory ...) FACTORY METHODS INSTEAD.
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: DO NOT USE THIS CONSTRUCTOR, USE create*(GenericFactory ...) FACTORY METHODS INSTEAD.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this section has READ permission.

NOTE: On a real system, sections don't have their own permissions, only the segments they live in do. However, Ghidra needs finer-grained control for analysis to work correctly, so we take control over section permissions to fit our needs. @return true if this section has READ permission
methods.name: isRead
methods.comment:
Returns true if this section has READ permission.
 
 NOTE: On a real system, sections don't have their own permissions, only the segments they 
 live in do.  However, Ghidra needs finer-grained control for analysis to work correctly, so 
 we take control over section permissions to fit our needs.

return.comment: true if this section has READ permission

methods.javadoc:

NOTE: On a real system, sections don't have their own permissions, only the segments they live in do. However, Ghidra needs finer-grained control for analysis to work correctly, so we take control over section permissions to fit our needs. @return true if this section has WRITE permission
methods.name: isWrite
methods.comment:
Returns true if this section has WRITE permission.
 
 NOTE: On a real system, sections don't have their own permissions, only the segments they 
 live in do.  However, Ghidra needs finer-grained control for analysis to work correctly, so

return.comment: true if this section has WRITE permission

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this section has EXECUTE permission.

NOTE: On a real system, sections don't have their own permissions, only the segments they live in do. However, Ghidra needs finer-grained control for analysis to work correctly, so we take control over section permissions to fit our needs. @return true if this section has EXECUTE permission
methods.name: isExecute
methods.comment:
Returns true if this section has EXECUTE permission.
 
 NOTE: On a real system, sections don't have their own permissions, only the segments they 
 live in do.  However, Ghidra needs finer-grained control for analysis to work correctly, so 
 we take control over section permissions to fit our needs.

return.comment: true if this section has EXECUTE permission

methods.name: getDataStream
methods.comment: Returns an input stream to underlying bytes of this section.

return.comment: an input stream to underlying bytes of this section

name: Section
comment: Represents a section and section_64 structure.
